info.title: Local Land Charge API
info.description: Land Registry Local Land Charge API

post.summary: Add a new Local Land Charge
post.description: Add a Local Land Charge to the Local Land Charge Register

201.description: URL to the GET endpoint for the Local Land Charge is returned on successful creation.

400.description: Bad Request due to invalid schema. Response will include 1 or more schema errors

get.summary: Get the Local Land Charge record
get.description: The Local Land Charge endpoint returns details of a specific local land charge record based on the unique primary id.

parameters.name: primary_id
parameters.description: Unique reference of the local land charge record.

200.description: A specific Local Land Charge record is returned

OldRegisterPart.description: The part of the Local Land Charges register that a Local Land Charge entry resides in prior to migration

Geometry.description: Spatial representation of the Local Land Charge. Can be a point, line polygon or a collection of geometry types.

FurtherInformation.description: The place (physical (mandatory) and virtual (optional)) where the relevant documents pertaining to a local land charge registration may be inspected and/or copies obtained.

Certificate.description: The date a definitive or temporary rights of light certificate was issued by the Lands Tribunal.

registration-date.description: Date of entry on the Land Charges Register, for existing charges it is the date entered on the current register

geo-description.description: A description of the land affected by the LLC in terms of its geographic location - i.e. it describes that depicted by an associated Polygon.

provision.description: The statutory provision(s) under which a local land charge has arisen, whether expressly (e.g. under s224 Highways Act 1980 or s106 Town and Country Planning Act 1990) or otherwise (e.g. conditional planning permission granted under s70 Town and Country Planning Act 1990).

charge-type.description: The general category of charge (e.g. Planning, Financial). A description of the general heading under which type of charge the specific charge falls. NB: For extant / migrated charges this is not necessarily the same as the part in which it has actually been registered, although in the majority of cases it will be.

migrating-authority.description: Local Authority from which and at which the Local Land Charge was migrated. Legacy field, not required for new Local Land Charge register.

authority_charge_id.description: The original ID of the charge given by the authority prior to migration

creation-date.description: The date a Local Land Charge first came into effect. This could be the date of the instrument, the date of the decision etc.

expiration-date.description: The date on which a Land Interest in respect of a local land charge ceases to exist.

instrument.description: The document giving rise to a Local Land Charge e.g. charge, deed, agreement etc.

originating-authority.description: The Minister of the Crown, government department, local authority or other person by whom the charge is brought into existence or by whom, on its coming into existence, the charge is enforceable

land-description.description: A verbal description of the land adjoining the land compulsorily purchased for public works.

works-particulars.description: A verbal description of the reason why the land adjoining the retained land was compulsorily acquired by an authority with compulsory purchasing powers - the particulars and extent of the works.

capacity-description.description: A description of the capacity in which the land was acquired; e.g. freehold.

compensation-paid.description: Amount already paid to the landowner from which the land was acquired in respect of damages to his retained land and the total sum agreed

applicant-name.description: The name of an applicant for a Light Obstruction Notice

applicant-address.description: The address of an applicant for a Light Obstruction Notice

land-interest-description.description: A short description of the interest held by the applicant for a Light Obstruction Notice in the servient land (i.e. the land benefitting from the notice - upon which a structure may be built).

building-description.description: A short description of the Dominant Building for a Light Obstruction Notice. When the owner of the servient land has obtained the relevant notice it is registered against the property described in the notice as the dominant bulding.

position-and-dimension.description: The position and dimension of a notional structure which if erected would block the light to the dominant land. This structure is notionally erected on the servient land (the dominant land is the subject of the charge).

documents-filed.description: Names of supporting documents for Light Obstruction Notice, typically more than 1 per charge.

archived.description: Boolean indicator to indicate whether the record has been archived

description.description: A description of the Light Obstruction Notice Document

image.description: Image of papers supporting the application for a Light Obstruction Notice.
